EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Inframark has developed this Risk Management Plan (RMP) and Process Safety Management (PSM) Plan to implement 29 C.F.R. 1910.119, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Standard regulating Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals (HHCs) at the Deer Creek Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP).



The PSM Plan is intended to assist those who may be affected by HHCs to be able to identify and understand the hazards posed by the processes that involve those chemicals.  The only HHCs currently present at the Deer Creek WWTP facilities above PSM Program applicability threshold quantities are chlorine and sulfur dioxide, which is stored as a compressed gas in 1 ton cylinders and 150 Lb. canisters respectfully.  Cylinders of compressed chlorine gas and sulfur dioxide are used in the Deer Creek wastewater treatment process.  



This RMP/PSM Plan is intended to prevent the occurrence of, or minimize the consequences of, catastrophic releases.  It is a written program stating Deer Creek WWTP policies and procedures for the management of chlorine and sulfur dioxide storage and use hazards in design, construction, start-up, operation, inspection, maintenance and training related to the OSHA Standard.



The RMP/PSM Plan requires employee participation.  Therefore, the Deer Creek WWTP PSM Plan is intended to: 



(1) work with employees and their representatives on the development of Process Hazard Analyses (PHA), 

(2) the development of the OSHA Standard's other elements of process safety management, and 

(3) provide to employees and their representatives access to the process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under the Standard.



This RMP/PSM Plan will be regularly reviewed and updated whenever necessary to reflect new or modified tasks and procedures.



A copy of the written elements of the RMP/PSM Plan, as well as the other documents and reports that are created pursuant to this Plan are

accessible to all employees who work in the Deer Creek WWTP and made available to other affected persons in accordance with applicable OSHA requirements.



It is Inframark's philosophy in operating the Deer Creek WWTP, to continually improve the safe working conditions of its employees to minimize accidents and reduce the potential for either an on-site or off-site release.
